Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for 3 months; abdominal pain; abdominal cramps; bloated stomach; underweight; no change in appetite; no blood in stool; tried olive oil for softer stools; concerned about seriousness of condition; request: wants to know if condition is serious and how to soften stools.
Objective: Vitals: not recorded; Abdomen: tender to palpation in lower left quadrant; bowel sounds: normal; tympani: varying; no abdominal masses; no costovertebral angle tenderness.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS); ruled out: no signs of ulcerative colitis or other serious conditions.
Plan: • Prescribe psyllium fibre sachets for 6 weeks to soften stools; • Advise patient to drink plenty of water with fibre sachets; • Schedule follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate results; • Safety net: if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or blood appears in stool, patient should contact office for earlier appointment; • Discuss dietitian referral at next visit.
